item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, May 14, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Bus stops here: Shanghai lets riders design their own routes (115 points | 58 comments)
2. RPG in a Box (76 points | 5 comments)
3. Type-constrained code generation with language models (168 points | 60 comments)
4. Flattening Rust’s learning curve (182 points | 130 comments)

6. Branch Privilege Injection: Exploiting branch predictor race conditions (355 points | 134 comments)
7. Google is building its own DeX: First look at Android's Desktop Mode (274 points | 220 comments)
8. How “The Great Gatsby” took over high school (34 points | 39 comments)
9. Show HN: HelixDB – Open-source vector-graph database for AI applications (Rust) (154 points | 64 comments)
10. Show HN: Mycelium (13 points | 2 comments)
11. Build real-time knowledge graph for documents with LLM (116 points | 18 comments)
12. Failed Soviet Venus lander Kosmos 482 crashes to Earth after 53 years in orbit (130 points | 91 comments)
13. Launch HN: Miyagi (YC W25) turns YouTube videos into online, interactive courses (172 points | 96 comments)
14. Mipmap selection in too much detail (30 points | 8 comments)
15. Multiple security issues in GNU Screen (364 points | 219 comments)
16. EM-LLM: Human-Inspired Episodic Memory for Infinite Context LLMs (38 points | 3 comments)

18. Writing that changed how I think about programming languages (10 points | discuss)
19. Airbnb is in midlife crisis mode (120 points | 202 comments)
20. It Awaits Your Experiments (154 points | 56 comments)
21. Garbage collection of object storage at scale (67 points | 9 comments)
22. Show HN: I’ve built an IoT device to let my family know when I’m in a meeting (69 points | 44 comments)
23. The world could run on older hardware if software optimization was a priority (648 points | 598 comments)
24. Using obscure graph theory to solve programming languages problems (48 points | 7 comments)
25. I learned Snobol and then wrote a toy Forth (127 points | 32 comments)
26. OpenTelemetry protocol with Apache Arrow (83 points | 15 comments)
27. Fingers wrinkle the same way every time they’re in the water too long (106 points | 41 comments)
28. A visual history of the safety pin (20 points | discuss)
29. A tool to verify estimates, II: a flexible proof assistant (37 points | discuss)
30. Cardiac: A CARDboard Illustrative Aid to Computation [pdf] (27 points | 14 comments)
